intro: Graecobolanthus thessalus, commonly known as the Thessalian sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are typically lance-shaped with a rough texture. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
